documents.document: Extraordinary how the simplest of fundraising ideas can connect with so many people. Congrats @macmillancoffee. https://t.co/HKCNBjE5ae
The end of an era. @GrantStottOnAir will be a big miss @forthone. A radio and panto legend. https://t.co/xoHVBYlQ9J
Brilliant programme for budding business people. https://t.co/9CKhG5AQAw
Great opportunity to join the board of @TeamWestLothian. They do invaluable work in promoting the area. https://t.co/o0n9G8bdZT.
@scvotweet At this rate you will have to move the event from the SECC to Hampden.
Well deserved recognition for Roger and the team at the Penicuik Community Alliance after years of hard work. https://t.co/zU2K9d4Hda
Despite defeat, an unbelievable effort from all involved @Bonnyriggrose81. Let's now go on and win the Junior Cup. https://t.co/T6XLIqTsjX
@FitbaHacks As a manager you plan all week & create a perfect tactical plan. Must be soul destroying when players don't execute it.
What an uplifting story. Another example of residents in a community delivering vital services. https://t.co/76F2hTwWRS
Some amazing cafes doing incredible work. None more so than West Lothian's excellent @lardercooking. https://t.co/P2nPdaP1vq
As I always suspected, having more connected communities and reducing social isolation benefits the economy. https://t.co/HJbVgZW3kW
@SophyRidgeSky Fair play to John Bercow. If I was sitting in the chair all day, I would also try and find ways to keep myself amused.
@Cat_Headley Indeed, I fear the next #indyref will be fought through the prism of asking people which institution they feel closer to.
@Cat_Headley As someone who voted Yes, I would most likely vote No this time. The case for independence is far weaker economically now.
@BroadcastMoose Don't know when you find time to rest, Moose. You are on the Breakfast Show every morning and a footie match most nights.
Interesting times ahead. Would love to be a fly on the wall during these negotiations with the EU. https://t.co/mq78QOd6R9
Nice to see the Scottish Government continue to support communities and the third sector. https://t.co/JXrDRQqdCR
Previously worked on a project that faced many difficulties. The response from @socinvestscot was always supportive… https://t.co/hbYoVak8aw
What an amazing moment. Richly deserved award for Joe Biden. https://t.co/8Gx6IGGqH8
Excellent blog highlighting the importance of befriending in reducing loneliness and isolation. https://t.co/IZbzJ4be9n
Fantastic article in the @LocalPeopleLead newsletter from the team at @Scotregen looking at alternatives to SIMD. https://t.co/389dyR967p.
Congratulations. It looks like an excellent and well attended event. https://t.co/s2EpF8h9I2
An incredibly thoughtful and personal piece. The number of people affected by mental health issues is growing. Govt… https://t.co/ueg14UTI9u
Quality advert. I loved watching Football Italia on a Saturday morning. https://t.co/VCxmsEDsZy
Excellent news for Scottish communities. https://t.co/D6MX8uCiAd
Would love a roundtable discussion with Barry, Kris and @GrahamSpiers on PLG. Graham's book on this subject is outs… https://t.co/50vPyDjQ2r
@Bonnyriggrose81 Will the tickets be available on any other day. I can't make it to NDP today.
Very sad to think that three of the biggest pop stars of the 80s, George Michael, Prince & Michael Jackson all died before they were 60.
Very late to the party on this, but this article analysing the history of community regeneration is fascinating. https://t.co/2BL5Lm0PiP
Bold move from Michael Sheen. https://t.co/mryB4cyyC8
Whoever puts together the #bbctw opening and closing videos deserves an award. The Snowman video with Aled Jones is tremendous.
@The_Tman10 The system doesn't help him, but he is essentially a striker who doesn't score any goals.
@RFC_Charity @alzscot Heard all about the amazing work that Football Memories does at a meeting this week. It is a fantastic project
@terracepodcast @DuncMcKay A truly outstanding piece of writing.
A very thoughtful piece from Martin Sime. Communities have to play a role in delivering social care. https://t.co/YPjcfKPveR
Looking forward to reading this. https://t.co/BXUdW4aDfK
BT Sport proving once again it has the best football coverage. @chris_sutton73 is spot on that Cathro deserves a ch… https://t.co/uSrcD9bAzt
Great topic from @MichelleDewbs. Technology is changing the workplace. Politicians need to look long term to re-skill people. #thepledge
@KCrawfordBBC Hope you'll be at the game to produce another one of your excellent videos, Kenny.
Some top tips from Tim from @WoodlandTrust on the art of fundraising. The story of their project is so inspiring. #communitiesinthecentre
Some incredible opportunities available to communities through the new Community Empowerment Act. #communitiesinthecentre @Dtascot_COSS
Congratulations to all involved with @Bonnyriggrose81. A well deserved win. Dumbarton were lucky not to have lost the first game.
Very depressing to discover that the new Hearts manager is younger than me.
Everyone who criticises politicians should watch #MPsBehindClosedDoors. Every week MPs help people with complex problems.
@FitbaHacks Much improved performance today, but classic case of goals changing games. Aberdeen well on top at the start of the 2nd half.
@LaudrupsHair That was one of the newspapers favourite transfer rumours. Every season Jess was supposed to be signing for Rangers.
@pieandbov Nothing Cammy Bell likes better than a penalty to save.
@IainDale Could an argument not be made that he was already preaching to the converted in that constituency. 69% voted Remain.
Great win for the Lib Dems in Richmond. Though, surely not a vote against Brexit when 69% of people already voted Remain in that area.
@BBCSportScot @KCrawfordBBC All of these videos from the Bonnyrigg game are outstanding. Gives a great glimpse of the atmosphere.
@TheRock All your success is thoroughly deserved.
@90sfootball Best programme on a Saturday morning.
@FitbaHacks Very strange tactics today. Aberdeen are wide open. Forrest ran for miles unchallenged.
@GerryHassan Nothing better than an afternoon watching junior football.
@terracepodcast @DuncMcKay Outstanding piece. Listened to the podcast last night & almost choked on my water when Chic suggested Jim Duffy.
Fantastic news. https://t.co/NWT189kby8
@TomCommentator Good luck with the launch. Looking forward to reading it.
@gerrymcculloch1 Remember that guy who called in a couple of weeks ago and predicted Brown would return after speaking to him at a function.
Strange to hear Jeremy Paxman giving his thoughts as a commentator rather than an interviewer, but really enjoying his insights. #theagenda.
@IsabelHardman Look after yourself and get well soon. As a self confessed political geek, I always enjoy your reasoned & balanced analysis.
@AgentScotland Rangers are only two points behind Hearts with 27 league games left. So, now is definitely not the time to get rid of Mark.
@AgentScotland We'll see, but Mark deserves the full season to try and get second place. October isn't the time to sack him.
@AgentScotland Even if they are well beaten today, there are 27 league games left. If they finish second, he gets another season.
@AgentScotland Untenable is a bit strong. An assessment will be made at the end of the season to see what progress Rangers have made.
Anyone would think that Nick Clegg is still leader of the Lib Dems. Heard far more from him on Brexit than Tim Farron.
Brilliant comments from Tom Hanks. https://t.co/4VPKZaDIhU
An absolutely riveting interview. Very jealous of @JananGanesh getting to have lunch with my favourite director… https://t.co/xtpyPWNFOZ
A triumphant return. #StillGame
@FitbaHacks Being a Gers & Scotland fan I hope he develops, but he has to improve his concentration levels. A mistake never seems far away.
@FitbaHacks It shows the lack of talent in Scotland if he's considered to be the future. No pace & flounders without experience beside him.
Feeling inspired after speaking to some incredible people at the @WL_SEN dinner. Thanks to Fiona and Colin for the invitation.
@pieandbov Should be a good game.
A truly inspiring day spent talking about the social benefits of sport at the @HolyroodEvents conference. #sportcomm
Amazing to hear the work that @HibsOfficial are doing in trying to tackle health inequalities in Edinburgh. #sportcomm
Not a Labour supporter, but this is quality from Tom Watson. Rightly citing the highlights of the Labour govt. https://t.co/8EtShiGbJr
@AgentScotland Excellent. Good to hear a positive story about Scottish football for once.
There won't be a better game all weekend than Dunfermline v St Mirren. The epitome of end to end football. Thank you @bbcalba.
The only hope that Labour has now is for Theresa May to call a quick General Election. It will be the only way to get rid off Corbyn.
Great work from @btsportfootball here. They prove again that their football coverage is much better than Sky. https://t.co/KZDQlnlxg5
Some unbelievable quotes in this article. Not sure if Barton is just being honest or is trying deliberately to get… https://t.co/YIq2NtwNDv
Every ground should have this pre-match. https://t.co/GKzvD40okV
Not surprised that Joey Barton is up to his old tricks. Always worried that he would ruin the balance of the team both on and off the park.
No doubt there will be an inquest about the state of Scottish football following Celtic's loss. Fact is that the financial gap is too wide.
I'm sure that it will have the same format, but can't see #GBBO working on Channel 4. It is the quintessential BBC programme.
First time watching a full episode of @ThePledge. A really fun format with a relaxed way of talking about current affairs.
@pieandbov Really surprised at their slow start to the season as they have experienced players. Finished last season strongly under Rae.
@FitbaHacks Central midfielders and wingers by the dozen, but no commanding central defenders.
Don't know why anyone is surprised by that Senderos red card. He has been making the same mistakes his entire career. #OldFirm
This is undoubtedly the best episode of #ScotlandsGame so far. Wonderful archive footage of Scotland games from the 80s and 90s.
This looks a fantastic cause and well worth doing. https://t.co/ivz4wSfJat
@holmleapark @FitbaHacks @RangersCulture Reyna put in an unbelievable shift as a makeshift right back during the 1999-2000 season.
Brilliant to hear about the fantastic food and gardening projects being delivered by @greenerkdy. So many great ideas to ponder. #dtas16
Fascinating opening plenary of #dtas16. Some eye-opening stats from @nourishscotland on the levels of food insecurity in the UK.
@FitbaHacks Another brilliant guest.
Amazing that development trusts are generating over £21 million of trading income. A huge contribution to local economies. #DTAS16
An inspiring visit to @wcdtgarden. A great way to kick off #DTAS16. https://t.co/37pmHSQdPw
Again the needs of television more important than the fans. https://t.co/gVaixNsSd5
New favourite podcast is @fitbahacks after binge listening to it over the weekend. A must for anyone with a love of Scottish football.
I can't wait to read the book that Jeremy Corbyn will inevitable write about his time as Labour leader. #traingate
@DerekMackaySNP @scotgov @StirUni I went to Stir Uni. The grounds are stunning no matter the season.
